intro: Henoonia brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's henoonia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, feathery appearance, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive species in conservation efforts.
